story.synopsys: In the city of Ancient Rome, amidst the opulent decadence and political unrest, a gruesome murder sends shockwaves through the elite society. It is the year -75, and the victim, a high-ranking senator, is found lifeless in his lavish villa, his body bizarrely staged as if to send a cryptic message. The intrigue deepens as whispers of power struggles, secret affairs, and hidden agendas permeate the city's shadows. In this treacherous labyrinth of deceit and ambition, everyone becomes a suspect, from the cunning courtesan to the ambitious general, each with their own motives and secrets to protect. With danger lurking behind every corner, an astute and relentless detective emerges, determined to untangle the web of lies and expose the truth that threatens to shatter the delicate harmony of Ancient Rome. Only by navigating the treacherous maze of politics and deception can the detective bring the murderer to justice, unmasking the culprit and unraveling the dark tapestry of this enthralling murder mystery.

background.backstory: Lucius Aurelius was a cunning and ambitious politician, known for his intricate plots and manipulation. He was well-versed in the art of deception and had a reputation for being involved in various conspiracies. Born into a noble family, Lucius was groomed from a young age to navigate the treacherous waters of Roman politics. He had a turbulent past, filled with scandal and controversy, which only fueled his thirst for power. Lucius was considered a mastermind in the shadows, always carefully orchestrating events to further his own agenda. His true motives and loyalties remained shrouded in mystery, making him a formidable player in the deadly game of political intrigue.
background.bias: Lucius Aurelius had a deep-seated bias against the victim, viewing them as a threat to his political aspirations. He believed the victim knew too much about his dark secrets and was capable of exposing him at any moment. Lucius saw the victim as a hindrance to his machinations and would stop at nothing to eliminate them, ensuring his own rise to power remained unchallenged.

background.backstory: John Doe is a skilled investigator, known for his sharp mind and ability to unravel complex mysteries. He has been solving crimes for over twenty years and has a reputation for getting results. His expertise in the field of intrigue makes him an invaluable asset in murder investigations.
background.bias: Due to his years of experience, John Doe tends to be suspicious of those who have something to hide. He believes that everyone has secrets and it's only a matter of time before those secrets are revealed. This bias often helps him uncover the truth behind intricate web of lies.

background.backstory: A prominent member of the Roman Empire known for his calculated and cunning political maneuvers. Marcus Aurelius is known for his ambitious nature and a strong desire for power. He is suspected to have had several secret affairs and connections with influential figures in the empire.
background.bias: Strongly believes in the preservation of traditional Roman values and is known to despise those who challenge the empire's authority.

background.backstory: Lucius Fulvius, a prominent Senator in ancient Rome, was known for his cunning and manipulative nature. He had a history of involvement in political conspiracies and had made many enemies along the way.
background.bias: Lucius had a strong bias against those who challenged his power or threatened his position in the Senate. He would go to great lengths to protect his reputation and eliminate anyone who posed a threat to his influence.

background.backstory: Livia Aurelia was born into a wealthy and powerful patrician family in ancient Rome. She grew up surrounded by political schemes and secret alliances, which greatly shaped her understanding of intrigue. Livia is known for her intelligence and charm, making her an influential figure in society. However, her desire for power and control often leads her to engage in manipulative tactics to achieve her goals.
background.bias: Livia has a deep-seated bias against the victim, driven by envy and rivalry. For years, she has been in fierce competition with the victim for social prestige and influence. Livia resents the victim's popularity and is willing to orchestrate devious plans to secure her position as the most respected member of the Roman elite.
